info.game_comments: David Bagley game 2.  First game of Season 15.

(1, 1).clue: This notice that consumers are encouraged to "look for" goes back to California carpenters in 1869

(2, 1).clue: Bruce Springsteen was born in 1949 in Freehold, near Asbury Park, in this state

(3, 1).clue: Amen to this leader whose statue represents Utah in Washington, D.C.'s Statuary Hall

(4, 1).clue: War during which "Gremlin", "Snafu" & "Kilroy Was Here" were popularized

(5, 1).clue: 39 years after "Goodbye, Columbus", this author won for his novel "American Pastoral"

(6, 1).clue: A bee,a con man,a sharp blow

(1, 2).clue: Abbreviated WGA, it provides many services to members, including script registration

(2, 2).clue: This longtime backup group was named for the address of the original keyboardist's mother

(3, 2).clue: On "Father Knows Best" he played dad to Betty, Bud & Kathy

(4, 2).clue: On September 14, 1847 U.S. troops raised the U.S. flag in this capital's Zocalo, or grand plaza

(5, 2).clue: This newspaper was shut out, but its ex-chairperson Katherine Graham won for her autobiography

(1, 3).clue: When he was killed in 1968, he was planning a march of striking Memphis sanitation workers

(2, 3).clue: This singer became Bruce's wife in 1991

(3, 3).clue: Of the 906 Major League Baseball games that he pitched, he won more than half; he deserves an award

(4, 3).clue: The Confederates bought a French-built ironclad & named it this, the nickname of General Jackson

(5, 3).clue: The history winner was about this 1925 event "And America's...debate over science and religion"

(1, 4).clue: It's the F in AFL-CIO as well as in the Stallone film "F.I.S.T."

(2, 4).clue: The Boss turned down $12 million from Chrysler to use this "All-American" song in ads

(3, 4).clue: In 1992 he released "Harvest Moon", a sequel to his "Harvest" album from 1972

(4, 4).clue: The Battle of the Little Big Horn was part of the Sioux Wars that also included the massacre here in 1890

(5, 4).clue: The prizewinning play "How I Learned to Drive" was inspired by Nabokov's novel about this girl

(1, 5).clue: A strike by this union shut down UPS for 15 days in 1997

(3, 5).clue: In a revealing memoir, Judy Lewis claims to be the "love child" of Clark Gable & this actress

(4, 5).clue: Mark Twain was among those who opposed the U.S. acquiring these Pacific islands from Spain in 1898

(5, 5).clue: A gold medal went to this state's Grand Forks Herald for coverage of a flood & other disasters

(6, 5).clue: A game of footsie,a bribe,a drunk person
(6, 5).correct response: Things that are done under the table

(1, 1).clue: In the U.S. this sex accounts for over 90% of the cases of gout

(2, 1).clue: The Olympic steeplechase has been won by men named Korir, Koriuki & Keter from this "K" country

(3, 1).clue: In Rome you can visit the tomb of these nameless warriors of the revolution

(4, 1).clue: Cain responded with this question when God asked where Abel was

(5, 1).clue: This term for a collection of maps arose because early ones pictured the titan of that name

(6, 1).clue: It would be easy to tear up the phone book of Winston, New Mexico, one of these "haunted" settlements

(1, 2).clue: Dr. Belding Scribner developed a shunt to allow long-term use of this kidney substitute

(2, 2).clue: This Nigerian-born center played for the U. of Houston's Phi Slamma Jamma before joining the NBA's Rockets

(3, 2).clue: A drum & bugle corps contest held annually is called "Drums Along" this nearby river

(4, 2).clue: In a Longfellow poem, Priscilla asks this when John Alden urges her to marry Miles Standish
(4, 2).correct response: Why don\'t you speak for yourself, John?

(5, 2).clue: Among other events in this Tolstoy novel, the emperor Napoleon shouts, sneers & takes snuff

(6, 2).clue: "Recent Interviews With" this author would be a lot shorter than his "Catcher In The Rye"

(4, 3).correct response: Is she really going out with him?

(5, 3).clue: Karl Marx didn't live to complete this 3-volume work laying out his economic ideas

(2, 4).clue: South African runner whose encounter with Mary Decker in the 1984 Olympic 3,000 meters made headlines

(4, 4).correct response: Would you hold it against me?
